Review: this is such a special movie… Urusevsky’s camerawork is obviously amazing (no other crane shots have outdone that crane shot!) but i also admire Kalatozov’s ability to use sound in a way that reinforces the movie’s ideological plot points (i.e. fuck US intervention and the US-backed Batista regime, fuck the property-owning class, etc) and makes the destructive effects of the united states’ grip on cuba at the time feel all the more haunting. some scenes i’m thinking about are:-…

Movie: The Little Girl Who Sold the Sun
Kate Bush - Live at the Hammersmith Odeon
What Do We See When We Look at the Sky?

Review: “reality meant little to me, and i knew absolutely nothing of life” .. agnès opened herself up to the world and life, embraced all possibilities, and resisted the urge to try to understand why things happened the way they did. instead she collected all these fragmented experiences, both joyful and devastating ones, of people and places in her life and chose to memorialize them through cinema even if doing so was painful sometimes. I’m feelin so moved and grateful after watching this gem
